Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Civil Rights

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass language in the 2011 Defense Authorization Act that would repeal “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Harass, Don’t Pursue” and to allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass language in the 2011 Defense Authorization Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass language in the 2011 Defense Authorization Act that would repeal “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Harass, Don’t Pursue” and to allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.MinutesNote: This Item was approved by and voted on by the Committee on Civil Rights.   Please refer to the Minutes of the Civil Rights Committee to see the complete vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved by Committee
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass language in the 2011 Defense Authorization Act.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Chin, Rose, Ferreras, Van Bramer and Seabrook.
